name: Dumbbell Exercises
description: Strength exercises using dumbbells - versatile, accessible, builds functional strength

exercises.name: Goblet Squat
exercises.description: Foundational squat holding weight at chest. Builds lower body strength while teaching proper squat mechanics.
instructions: Hold dumbbell at chest height with both hands, vertically
Feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly out (10-15 degrees)
Keep chest proud and shoulders back
Squat down by pushing hips back, then bending knees
Descend until thighs parallel or slightly below
Keep weight in heels, knees tracking over toes
Drive through heels to stand, exhale on the way up

modifications.easier: Reduce weight, limit depth to comfortable range, or use chair for balance
modifications.harder: Increase weight, pause 3 seconds at bottom, or tempo slow (3-1-3)

conditions.knee: Limit depth to pain-free range, focus on control over depth
conditions.lower_back: Keep torso upright, use lighter weight, engage core throughout
conditions.hip: Widen stance, reduce depth, focus on hip hinge pattern

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift (RDL)
exercises.description: Hip hinge movement targeting hamstrings and glutes. Essential for runners and lower back health.
instructions: Hold dumbbells at thighs, feet hip-width apart
Slight knee bend (soft knees, not locked)
Hinge at hips, push butt back, keep back flat
Lower dumbbells down shins until hamstring stretch (not rounding back)
Feel the stretch in hamstrings, not lower back
Drive hips forward to stand, squeeze glutes at top
Keep dumbbells close to legs throughout

modifications.easier: Use lighter weight, reduce range of motion, single-leg with kickstand
modifications.harder: Increase weight, single-leg RDL, tempo slow (3-1-3)

conditions.lower_back: Start very light, focus on hip hinge not back bend, engage core
conditions.hamstring: Reduce range of motion, stop at first stretch sensation

exercises.name: Single-Arm Dumbbell Row
exercises.description: Fundamental pulling movement for upper back. Addresses imbalances, builds posture.
instructions: Place one knee and hand on bench for support
Other foot on ground, hold dumbbell in free hand
Back flat, core engaged, slight forward lean
Pull dumbbell to hip, leading with elbow
Squeeze shoulder blade at top
Lower with control, full arm extension
Keep back flat throughout - don't rotate torso

modifications.easier: Reduce weight, use resistance band, reduce range of motion
modifications.harder: Increase weight, pause at top, slow tempo (3-1-3)

conditions.lower_back: Focus on keeping back flat, use bench for support, lighter weight
conditions.shoulder: Reduce range of motion, focus on scapular retraction not arm pull

exercises.name: Dumbbell Overhead Press
exercises.description: Vertical pressing movement. Builds strong shoulders. Functional for overhead activities.
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width, hold dumbbells at shoulder height
Palms facing forward, elbows slightly in front of body
Brace core, slight knee bend for stability
Press dumbbells overhead until arms fully extended
Don't arch your back - keep core tight
Lower with control back to shoulder height
Dumbbells should travel slightly back as they go up

modifications.easier: Reduce weight, seated press for back support, single-arm
modifications.harder: Increase weight, standing on one leg, add pause at top

conditions.shoulder: Reduce range of motion, ensure pain-free arc, may need physio clearance
conditions.lower_back: Keep core engaged, don't arch back, may sit for support

exercises.name: Dumbbell Reverse Lunge
exercises.description: Unilateral leg movement with added resistance. Reverse lunge easier on knees than forward lunge.
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides, feet hip-width apart
Step back with one leg, landing on ball of foot
Lower body until front thigh parallel to ground
Back knee hovers just above ground
Keep torso upright, core engaged
Push through front heel to return to start
Alternate legs or complete all reps on one side

modifications.easier: Reduce weight, hold wall for balance, reduce depth
modifications.harder: Increase weight, increase step distance, add pulse at bottom

conditions.knee: Reduce depth to pain-free range, ensure knee stays over ankle
conditions.balance_issues: Start without weights, hold wall, reduce step distance

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl
exercises.description: Classic bicep isolation. Simple, effective, straightforward movement.
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width, dumbbells at sides
Palms facing forward, elbows close to body
Keep upper arms stationary, curl weights up
Squeeze biceps at top, don't swing or use momentum
Lower with control back to start
Don't let elbows drift forward or back
Keep wrists straight throughout

modifications.easier: Reduce weight, alternate arms, use resistance band
modifications.harder: Increase weight, tempo slow (3-1-3), hammer curl variation

conditions.elbow: Reduce weight, focus on controlled movement, may need to avoid
conditions.wrist: Keep wrists straight, may use straps or different grip

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
exercises.description: Shoulder isolation for side delts. Builds shoulder width and stability.
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width, dumbbells at sides
Slight bend in elbows, palms facing body
Keep core engaged, don't swing or use momentum
Raise dumbbells out to sides until shoulder height
Lead with elbows, not hands - pour a jug motion
Pause briefly at top
Lower with control back to sides

modifications.easier: Reduce weight, use resistance band, reduce range
modifications.harder: Increase weight, tempo slow (3-1-3), add pause at top

conditions.shoulder: Reduce weight and range, stop if painful, may need physio clearance

exercises.name: Farmer's Carry
exercises.description: Loaded carry exercise. Functional strength for carrying groceries, luggage. Works everything.
instructions: Hold heavy dumbbells at sides, one in each hand
Stand tall with shoulders back, core engaged
Walk forward with steady, controlled steps
Keep shoulders level - don't let one side sag
Maintain upright posture throughout
Breathe steadily, don't hold breath
Turn around carefully and return to start

modifications.easier: Reduce weight, shorten distance, use kettlebells
modifications.harder: Increase weight, increase distance, uneven load (one heavy, one light)

conditions.shoulder: Reduce weight, keep shoulders packed down
conditions.lower_back: Lighter weight, focus on core engagement, shorter distance
conditions.wrist: May use straps, or farmer's walk handles if available

exercises.name: Dumbbell Step-Up
exercises.description: Unilateral leg exercise mimicking stair climbing. Highly functional, builds balance.
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides, stand facing bench or step
Step up with one foot, full foot on bench
Drive through heel to lift body up
Bring other foot up to meet it
Step down with control, same leg leads
Complete all reps on one leg, then switch
Keep torso upright throughout

modifications.easier: Reduce weight, lower step height, hold rail
modifications.harder: Increase weight, higher step, add knee drive at top

conditions.knee: Lower step height, reduce weight, ensure full foot on step
conditions.balance_issues: Start without weight, hold rail, lower step

exercises.name: Dumbbell Glute Bridge
exercises.description: Glute activation with added resistance. Hip extension strength for running and lower back health.
instructions: Lie on back, knees bent, feet flat on floor
Place dumbbell on hips, hold with both hands
Feet hip-width apart, about a foot from bum
Push through heels to lift hips off floor
Squeeze glutes hard at top
Create straight line from shoulders to knees
Lower with control and repeat

modifications.easier: Reduce weight, reduce range of motion, bodyweight only
modifications.harder: Increase weight, single leg variation, pause 3 seconds at top

conditions.lower_back: Start light, focus on glute squeeze not back arch
